result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus M Thurmon Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit For Time Served 59 Days, If Revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Cost and Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $50.00 per month starting the Third month of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Obtain a valid driver's license within the First 4 months.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.

timeConds.notes: Per year of Probation.  During the Second Year the Community Service must be completed within the First 10 months.
